thread.title: Business Breakfast LIVE: Foreign business share views on Brexit; plus latest news
thread.title_full: Business Breakfast LIVE: Foreign business share views on Brexit; plus latest news

author: Kathryn Riddell
title: Business Breakfast LIVE: Foreign business share views on Brexit; plus latest news
text:
08:08 Kathryn Riddell Research shows range of international reactions to Brexit 
Foreign businesses view the UK’s vote for Brexit with a mixture of apprehension, uncertainty and optimism, according to research by Newcastle law firm Ward Hadaway. 
The company, which also offices in Leeds and Manchester, canvassed opinion from firms in the Geneva Group International, a worldwide body of professional services companies, of which it is a member. Yui Mok/PA Wire The Union Jack pictured next to the European Union flag 
Accountants and lawyers from Europe, Asia, Australia, the Far East and the USA contributed to the Ward Hadaway study, showing a range of opinions on Brexit. 
Reactions received ranged from surprise and fears of a downturn in trade to those who thought the move could be a positive one for the UK and for their own country. 08:00 Kathryn Riddell Morning all 
Good morning and welcome to the Journal Business team’s morning live blog for Monday, September 19. 
I’m Kathryn Riddell and I’m in the live blog chair this week to bring you regular updates on all the breaking business news from across the North East and beyond. 
The business breakfast live blog covers the latest big stories from the region’s business community, as well as national news, FTSE updates and stock exchange announcements from the Journal region’s listed companies and national firms - anything and everything from the world of business basically. 
Our top story today is the views of foreign businesses on Brexit as reported by Newcastle law firm Ward Hadaway.
